pymbt Package¶

common_data Module¶

Defines data and parameters in an easily resuable format.

pymbt.common_data.codon_table = {'A': ['GCG', 'GCA', 'GCT', 'GCC'], 'C': ['TGT', 'TGC'], 'E': ['GAG', 'GAA'], 'D': ['GAT', 'GAC'], 'G': ['GGG', 'GGA', 'GGT', 'GGC'], 'F': ['TTT', 'TTC'], 'I': ['ATA', 'ATT', 'ATC'], 'H': ['CAT', 'CAC'], 'K': ['AAG', 'AAA'], '*': ['TGA', 'TAG', 'TAA'], 'M': ['ATG'], 'L': ['TTG', 'TTA', 'CTG', 'CTA', 'CTT', 'CTC'], 'N': ['AAT', 'AAC'], 'Q': ['CAG', 'CAA'], 'P': ['CCG', 'CCA', 'CCT', 'CCC'], 'S': ['AGT', 'AGC', 'TCG', 'TCA', 'TCT', 'TCC'], 'R': ['AGG', 'AGA', 'CGG', 'CGA', 'CGT', 'CGC'], 'T': ['ACG', 'ACA', 'ACT', 'ACC'], 'W': ['TGG'], 'V': ['GTG', 'GTA', 'GTT', 'GTC'], 'Y': ['TAT', 'TAC']}¶

Saccharomyces cerevisiae source: http://www.kazusa.or.jp/codon/ (which cites GenBank, i.e. yeast genome project CDS database)

nupack Module¶

Wrapper for NUPACK 3.0.

class pymbt.nupack.Nupack(sequence_list, material)[source]¶

Contain sequence inputs and use NUPACK computation methods.

close()[source]¶

Delete the temp dir. This prevents filling up /tmp.

complexes(max_complexes, mfe=True, T=50)[source]¶

Run ‘complexes’.

Parameters:
  • max_complexes (int.) – maximum complex size (integer).
  • mfe (bool.) – include mfe calculations (boolean, defaults to True).
  • T (float.) – sets the temperature.
concentrations(max_complexes, conc=5e-07, mfe=True)[source]¶

Run ‘concentrations’.

Parameters:
  • conc (float or list.) – the concentration of each species. Defaults to 0.5e-6.
  • max_complexes – maximum complex size.

:type int. :param mfe: include mfe calculations. :type bool.

mfe(strand, T=50)[source]¶

Run ‘mfe’.

Parameters:T (float.) – temperature.
pairs(strand, T=50)[source]¶

Run ‘pairs’.

Parameters:T (float.) – sets the temperature.
pymbt.nupack.nupack_multiprocessing(inputs, material, cmd, arguments, report=True)[source]¶

Provides access to NUPACK commands with multiprocessing support.

Parameters:
  • inputs – list of sequences.
  • material (str.) – ‘dna’ or ‘rna’.
  • cmd (str.) – command: ‘mfe’, ‘pairs’, ‘complexes’, or ‘concentrations’.
  • arguments (str.) – arguments for the command.
pymbt.nupack.run_nupack(kwargs)[source]¶

Create Nupack instance, run command with arguments.

primer_design Module¶

Primer design tools.

pymbt.primer_design.design_primer(seq, tm=72, min_len=10, tm_errorminus=1, tm_errorplus=3, endGC=False, overhang='')[source]¶

Design primer to a nearest-neighbor Tm setpoint.

Parameters:
  • seq (str.) – input sequence.
  • tm (float.) – ideal primer Tm.
  • min_len (int.) – minimum primer length.
  • tm_errorminus (float.) – allowed Tm undershoot.
  • tm_errorplus (float.) – allowed Tm overshoot.
  • endGC (bool.) – obey the ‘end on G or C’ rule.
  • overhang (str.) – append the primer to this overhang sequence.
pymbt.primer_design.design_primer_gene(seq, overhangs=['', ''], **kwargs)[source]¶

Design both forward and reverse primers for a sequence.

Parameters:
  • seq (str.) – input sequence.
  • overhangs (list.) – list of overhang sequences.
  • **kwargs –

    keyword arguments to feed to design_primer.

sequence_manipulation Module¶

pymbt.sequence_manipulation.check_alphabet(sequence, material='dna')[source]¶

Verifies that a given sequence is made only of DNA, RNA, or peptides

pymbt.sequence_manipulation.reverse_complement(sequence)[source]¶

Simple reverse complement function

pymbt.sequence_manipulation.translate_seq(sequence)[source]¶

Input is DNA, output is peptide. This script expects only peptide sequence. If it doesn’t find that, it errors

tm_calc Module¶

Calculate the thermodynamic melting temperatures of nucleotide sequences using the Finnzymes modified Breslauer 1986 parameters.

pymbt.tm_calc.calc_tm(s, dnac=50, saltc=50, method='finnzymes')[source]¶

Returns DNA/DNA tm using nearest neighbor thermodynamics.

dnac is DNA concentration in nM saltc is salt concentration in mM. par is the parameter set to use (finnzymes, santaluciai, sugimoto)
